content.description: A hard sit start to a terrible sidepull lead to better holds and the top.
content.location: On the far left end of the west side of the boulder. Sit start at bad sidepulls under the overhang.

content.description: Sit start as for Cosmic Monsters on a good rail, but climb up and right along slopers. Don't bail rightwards into The Hydra. A bit contrived.
content.location: Begins at the short, overhanging face on the east side of the boulder at obvious good rail.

content.description: High step onto the ledge at the base of the shallow dihedral. Press and pull to the top.
content.location: The shallow dihedral on the south side of the boulder.

content.description: Start at bad holds in the quartz vein. Pop to the big ledge hold and then either do a huge lockoff move up to the jugs near the top or commit to intermediate slopers.
content.location: Starts just right of the large tree on the north side of the boulder. Climbs above a distinctive tree route jutting out of the ground (watch your landing!).

content.description: Sit start at the left facing layback flake. Pull up into the jug and climb edges to the top.
content.location: Starts at on obvious left facing flake on the south side of the boulder.

content.description: Climb's ledge holds, jugs and a horizontal crack to the top. One of the easier ways up or down.
content.location: Starts on obvious jugs on the corner of the boulder near a small hemlock tree. Starts just left of Chephalapod.

content.description: Start on blocky sidepulls and squeeze your way up the rounded arete to slopers at the top. Short and burly.
content.location: The low, blunt arete on the south side of the boulder. Just right of the dihedral of The Step.

content.description: Climb the face through the white band of rock (fingery pocket/crimps) with a big move to the horizontal crack near the top. Mantle over the lip.
content.location: Start at the obvious band of white rock that runs diagonally across the north side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start as for Twisted Tentacle at a good rail. Move up and left to a ledge and mantle.
content.location: Starts at the small overhang on the east side of the boulder at a good rail.

content.description: Balance on the low slab. Grab small finger pockets and pull to hidden jug at the lip.
content.location: Starts just left of the big tree on the north side of the boulder.

content.description: A large boulder with several good climbs, great landings, and lots of sunlight.
